questions.prompt: What is the formula for average power in an AC circuit?
questions.explanation: Average power P = ½VmIm·cos(θv - θi), where (θv - θi) is the phase difference between voltage and current. Equivalently, P = Vrms·Irms·cos(θv - θi).

questions.prompt: What is the RMS value of a sinusoid with peak value Vm?
questions.explanation: For a sinusoid Vm·cos(ωt+φ), the RMS value is Vm/√2 ≈ 0.707Vm. This is derived from the definition: √(mean of v²(t) over one period).

questions.prompt: What is the unit of reactive power Q?
questions.explanation: Reactive power is measured in VAR (volt-amperes reactive). Real power is in W (watts), and apparent power is in VA (volt-amperes). These distinct units help avoid confusion.

questions.prompt: The power factor is defined as:
questions.explanation: Power factor = cos(θv - θi) = P/S. It represents the fraction of apparent power that is converted to useful real power.
Lagging means current LAGS voltage — this happens with inductive loads (ELI). Motors are the most common example. Leading power factor indicates capacitive loads.

questions.prompt: Complex power S is calculated as:
questions.explanation: Complex power S = ½VI* (with peak values) or S = Vrms·Irms* (with RMS). The conjugate of I is essential — using I (not I*) gives the wrong phase angle.

questions.prompt: In the power triangle, what does the hypotenuse represent?
questions.explanation: The hypotenuse is apparent power S (in VA). The horizontal leg is P (watts) and the vertical leg is Q (VAR). S² = P² + Q².

questions.prompt: How much average power does an ideal inductor absorb?
questions.explanation: An ideal inductor has Z = jωL (purely imaginary). The phase difference is 90°, so cos(90°) = 0 and P = 0. The inductor stores and returns energy each cycle — no net dissipation.

options: A) Only real power P is conserved
B) Only reactive power Q is conserved
C) Both P and Q are individually conserved
D) Apparent power S is conserved
questions.correctAnswer: C) Both P and Q are individually conserved
questions.explanation: Conservation of complex power ΣS_sources = ΣS_loads means both ΣP_sources = ΣP_loads AND ΣQ_sources = ΣQ_loads. Both real and reactive power are individually conserved.

questions.prompt: Why is the mains supply voltage specified as 230 V, not 325 V?
options: A) Because 230 V is the average value
B) Because 230 V is the RMS value, which gives equivalent DC heating power
C) Because 230 V is the peak-to-peak value
D) It is an arbitrary standard
questions.correctAnswer: B) Because 230 V is the RMS value, which gives equivalent DC heating power
questions.explanation: 230 V is the RMS value. Vpeak = 230√2 ≈ 325 V. RMS is used because a 230 V RMS AC supply delivers the same average power to a resistive load as a 230 V DC supply.

questions.prompt: What is the relationship between S, P, and Q?
questions.explanation: Since S = P + jQ, |S|² = P² + Q². This is the Pythagorean relationship in the power triangle. P is the horizontal leg, Q the vertical leg, and S the hypotenuse.
